result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph John Woodard II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to undergo domestic abuse counseling and comply with any recommendations

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Joseph John Woodard in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 15CF117 & 15CF141.  Rights/Elements.  In 15CF117 defendant pled no contest to Ct. 2.  In 15CF141 defendant pled no contest to Ct. 2 with repeater enhancer dismissed.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  In 15CF117 court dismissed but read in Ct. 1.  On Ct. 2 court withheld sentence, placed defendant on probation for 18 months. Conditions of probation include: $543.00 costs. Successful completion of domestic abuse counseling and comply.  3 days jail credit.  In 15CF141 court dismissed but read in Ct. 1. and dismissed the repeater enhancer in Ct. 2.  On Ct.2 court withheld sentence, placed defendant on probation for 18 months.  Conditions of probation include $443.00 costs.  Successful completion of domestic abuse counseling and comply.  3 days jail credit.   Defendant must contact probation and parole in Juneau County tomorrow or report to Portage office no later than Friday afternoon.
Return date at 08-11-2015 02:45 pm
Atty. Ryan Frank requests July 8th return be reset - scheduling conflict - fax

Defendant Joseph John Woodard not in Court.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Frank not present, Atty Kohlwey requesting new return,  Return date scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
and Notice of DNA and Witness List with Petition for Leave to file Additional Motions filed by  ADA Crystal Long

request for contact received from victim

Defendant, Joseph John Woodard, appeared. Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant wants an atty.  Atty Rights explained.  Defendant wants to proceed without atty. but wants an atty at a later date.  Court explained preliminary hearing to defendant.  Explained time limits to defendant.  Court also explained a pretrial conferance.  Matter was adjourned by court to give defendant time to decide how to proceed.  Case recalled.  Defendant would like to get an atty.  Defendant waives time limits.  New dates were given for pretrial and return.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 02:00 pm.  Return date scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
No contact with J.W. or her residence.  May return 1x with law enforcement to get personal belongings.  Standard felony conditions.

Defendant Joseph John Woodard by video, in custody with attorney Adam Raabe.  Christine M. Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  $2000.00 signature bond.  No contact with J.W. or her residence.  May return 1x with law enforcement to get personal belongings.  Standard felony conditions.  Defendant does not waive time limits for preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
